metadata.title: CVE-2021-3759 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A memory overflow vulnerability was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s ipcfunctionality of the memcg subsystem, in the way a user calls the semgetfunction multiple times, creating semaphores. This flaw allows a local userto starve the resources, causing a denial of service. The highest threatfrom this vulnerability is to system availability.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
